title: Inheritance (Blueprints Based on Blueprints)
simplifierConcept:
Imagine a car factory has a 'Vehicle' blueprint with wheels, engine, steering. Now they want to make a 'Car' - instead of starting from scratch, they say: 'Take the Vehicle blueprint and ADD doors, trunk, and seats!'

That's INHERITANCE! You create a new class BASED ON an existing one:
• The original class = BASE CLASS (or parent, superclass)
• The new class = DERIVED CLASS (or child, subclass)

The derived class INHERITS everything from the base class and can ADD NEW features or MODIFY existing ones.

Example: Animal (base) → Dog (derived)
• Animal has: Name, Age, Eat(), Sleep()
• Dog inherits ALL of those AND adds: Breed, Bark()

Inheritance promotes CODE REUSE - don't repeat yourself! Write common features once in the base class, share with all derived classes.

syntaxBreakdown.explanation: The colon ':' means 'inherits from'. Car is the DERIVED class, Vehicle is the BASE class. Car gets ALL of Vehicle's members automatically!
Car automatically has Brand, Year, Start(), Stop() even though you didn't write them! They come from Vehicle. You can use them immediately on Car objects.
Derived classes can ADD new fields, properties, and methods. Car adds Doors and OpenTrunk(). Base class (Vehicle) doesn't have these!
In C#, a class can only inherit from ONE base class! Can't do 'class Car : Vehicle, Machine'. But you can chain: Vehicle → Car → SportsCar.

challenge.instructions:
Create an animal hierarchy!

1. BASE CLASS 'Animal':
   - Properties: string Name, int Age
   - Method Eat(): prints '[Name] is eating'
   - Method Sleep(): prints '[Name] is sleeping'

2. DERIVED CLASS 'Dog' inherits Animal:
   - Add property: string Breed
   - Add method Bark(): prints 'Woof!'

3. DERIVED CLASS 'Cat' inherits Animal:
   - Add property: string Color
   - Add method Meow(): prints 'Meow!'

4. Create a Dog and a Cat, set their properties, call all methods (inherited and own)
challenge.hint: Use 'class Derived : Base' syntax. Derived class automatically gets all Base members. Add new members in the derived class body.
commonStickingPoints: Forgetting the colon: 'class Dog Animal' is WRONG! Must be 'class Dog : Animal' with the colon to inherit.
Trying to inherit from multiple classes: C# doesn't support multiple inheritance! 'class Dog : Animal, Pet' is ERROR. Can only inherit from ONE class.
Redefining inherited members: If Dog has 'public string Name;' and Animal already has it, Dog gets TWO Name fields (confusing!). Don't redefine - just use the inherited one!
Access modifiers: Derived class can't access PRIVATE members of base class! Use protected or public in base class if derived class needs access.
